Replies.Reply: Sir. Sir, may I have a ticket to Montreal please?
I need a ticket to Montreal.
Yes, sir.     Please.
Martin.     Nice to meet you.
Away from here.
Pisswater.
You have a license?
I got one.   Let's go.
You take a hockey puck in the face?
You got cracked good.
Why'd he hit you?
I would have popped you too.
You going back?
I know some chords.
He can't believe what he has just done.       He takes in the carnage, tugs at his ear.
I know now that what you did to me was not love.
Pardon?
Montreal?
Forty-three dollars.
Dan Soulsby.
Where you heading to?
At least it's cold pisswater.
That was bad.
It's gonna take all day to get another bus here.
Had one.    They took it away.
See that?    They're all fake.
A fist. My stepdad socked me. I flew across the room and dented the sheetrock in the kitchen. My mom saw everything and still took his side.
I hate that guy. Two hundred pounds of worthless grease.
I wrecked his sixty-five Mustang and his boat in the same week.
It was worth it. But I didn't deserve the tour in hell.
Don't ever go to military school if you can help it. It sucks.
I jumped the wall two days ago.
I'm done with that racket. I'm going to Seattle and playing music.
Think you can learn drums?
I'm the next Billy Squire. Krokus will be opening for me one day.
Shit.
I just saw my dead son get off the ferry.
Listen to me; he's been dead eighteen years. He just walked right past me.
You need to open that grave.   It can't be my son in there.
Inspector, I'm saddened by your loss and touched by loyalty. But let's focus on the matter at hand.
Yes. Of course he's a man. He'd be thirty-two. And no, I did not speak with him. I ran.
Inspector, my son was very, very disturbed. He had serious emotional problems. I assure you he was.
Is. Is a dangerous person.
No.   Inspector. He is not.
I lost my mother two years ago.
Did you talk to this man, he is a man now?

Madame. The police department cannot resolve your problem. You need to get permits from the coroner and health and safety department. You pay for an exhumation. You have someone qualified examine the remains. If it is the wrong body, the Forensic Examiner will confirm there is a problem and call us. Then we open an investigation.
No, Quebec City police will investigate. He is buried there, no?
Someone call the cops.
Think she will like this?
We are lucky the FBI is sending her. She is the Michael Jordan of criminal profiling.
The Guy Le Fleuer of profiling.
Inspector Laval.
Have the airline check again.
Agent Vanderholt, we requested your help. I'm Inspector Laval, this is Inspector Reynaud.
This was a meter from the skull.
It might be trash a camper left.
That is a theory.
Say hello to a dead man.
This is more than we had. Thank you.
We named the victim; Curtis Kohler. The forensic dentist just verified the ID.
No. K-O-H-L-E-R. The initials are for the Montreal River Company. Kohler worked there as a guide three years ago. The owner remembers him because he stole the wetsuit.
Yes, of course.
Let's go down the street. Very good food. We are inviting you.
Very solid time of death. Two years ago.
Dead men don't pay their bills.

You are a heavy sleeper.

That's him.   He says he saw the killer.

There.   Under his car.

They were kicked. During the struggle.

Put a number and seal on that case.
No.

Director, please. We are getting close. The hairs recovered from the apartment match the hairs recovered at the crime scene on Ford's body. We found hours of video like that of the victim. He has been following him, filming him for weeks. He tapped his phone and has recordings of Ford's calls. Even a CD with copies of Mr. Ford's E-mail folders.
We know what he looks like, we have his fingerprints, we know what he had for breakfast. But his name eludes us still.
Yes, sir.
I'm fair and I keep my promises.
I trust their fear of this.
Mr. Ford worked as a cruise-ship musician. He would walk around and play his guitar on the decks at night.
He targeted Mr. Ford the night before he was supposed to get on a plane and meet a ship in Aruba.
You're always thinking. Save something for tomorrow. We have three boxes of evidence to go through.
My papa dropped dead of a heart attack in front of a drill press at work. Not me.
No hits. He's never been fingerprinted.
Nothing. I think he became Edwards a year ago. He was a software engineer. Did everything by the internet, he never met anyone face to face.

Is anything missing.

You will be safe, my friend.
I wish I had his patience. He should be a cop. His mother should be punished. Like the owner of pit bulls that attack kids.
Three.
Dan Soulsby. He went missing from the Alberta Military Institute two days before the accident.
Yes. They are also 'no questions answered.' Mr. Kohler suddenly paid off his credit card bills, thanks to money from Edwards.

I hope the son of a bitch doesn't shoot me with the gun you gave him. What else did you give Asher?

This was not a heat of the moment killing. And the victim was buried complete with head. The grave was five-foot ten. The victim's height. With square corners. Dug with a shovel the killer had the foresight to bring.

No. A large canine did that.
Bingo.   That's your murder weapon.

Call 'em. Then show the results to everybody around who was selling outdoor goods two years ago. You have his initials; MRC, inside the wetsuit. The long hair is distinctive, someone may recognize him. It's a semi-long shot.

No headhunters, sir.   However, a killer is out there.
He wasn't missed. He had no family, or moved often. He had the musculature of a serious outdoorsman. He spent a lot of time in his kayak.

Always is, sir. I can give you a rough profile; white male, thirty to thirty-four. Has some college but no degree. Neat in appearance. At least six feet tall. Very intelligent. Charming when necessary. He uses murder as a tool, probably in furtherance of a criminal endeavor. He's killed before and will again unless caught.
A couple days, sir.

With a C?

It's a crab that lives in the shells of dead sea snails.

They live in these beautiful shells because they have these soft ugly bodies. They couldn't survive without the shells.
With that much detail, you could become anyone.
More like a kind of camouflage.

If you remember any details or need anything.

Morning. Can you run this name?

Let me go and be non-threatening.

She didn't have one picture of Martin. Not one. Even cut him out of the old yearbooks. And she had a basement door like a vault.
You're right. We should make sure her front door is locked.
Yeah, I'll get 'em.
Let's be friends.
I think I just shaved ten years off my life.
Yes. Rabies scares me.     Only rabies. Nothing else.

At the art gallery?
Are they still there?

We'll be right there. I'm sending a car. Don't touch anything.

How do we know Costa didn't stage this? For attention or something.
We should take the computer.
Should I believe you?
Or should I believe this.
Mr. Costa, is that the man you saw kill Mr. Ford in the parking lot?
Thank you.   I just needed you to say it.
John, no harm will come to you.
We want you to be there tonight.
He won't get within fifty feet of you. The second we see him, the cuffs go on.
Costa fits Asher's choice of victims. Travels the World looking for art. Single. No kids or anything.
Asher's here somewhere. Watching.
You got kids?
Don't keep them in a cage.
I know you have a life. So did the people who have lost theirs.
If somebody else dies, and you know you could have done more to stop it, you're going to feel like shit for a very long time, Mr.
It's okay to be scared.
You saw him and that's enough.
I can't promise you that.
A car is watching the gallery.
I'm sure Soulsby's death was a homicide, Asher saw the opportunity and took it. He became Soulsby and bummed around Seattle for a couple years.

Costa saw him. Costa caught him in the act, caught him being Martin Asher. Seen first by his mother, then by Costa. For the first time he's failed at taking a life, and since we found the apartment, he can't be Edwards.
Likely dead and buried south of the border somewhere.
South of the American border somewhere. Visa records put Asher, using Kohler's ID and Edwards at a Mexican surf resort.
He's focused on Costa. Who fits the profile of Asher's victims.
It does sound crazy. That's what the press likes, sir.
Security is going to be very solid tonight.
He won't show. But we want to be here in case he does. Four plainclothes officers will form a perimeter watching the four corners.
Yes. And four plainclothes officers will be in here.
The officers will be very discreet. We won't interfere with your thing.
Sure.     If you feel safer.
Thanks.
This isn't me.
I'm trying to get into the show, but I mean. What is this? It looks like somebody napalmed the Garden of Eden.

Always is.

Now he's dead and you get rich?

An FBI agent?

We got his name. We catch everyone sooner or later.
I'm done profiling you.   I got you figured out.

What you need.   Movers can get the rest.

This hurt?

Very dead.

He got off light. With a broken wrist and fifty stitches. Lucky man.

Hey.

Anytime. Do you know where he was taking you?

Let me take you out tonight.

I can stop monsters, John.     And because I can, I have to.
Neither.   It's just my job.
Roy Wilson.
You're a sharp one, John Costa.
That's right. You were the cheese in the trap. We stopped a monster.
I'm sorry.   I'm a pig.
Want a beer?

People like me?
You are a trip, John Costa.
Okay. I guess I'm running and chasing.

Growing up I quit speaking after that. I didn't say a word for three years. When you're not in the conversation, you get forgotten real quick. So I'd watch people. Study them. The mouth can say anything, but the body doesn't lie. The tilt of the head, the way the hands move.
The day my Uncle died. The truth exploded out of me like a vision.
I remember my Uncle telling me not to say anything. And I didn't.
I made myself forget why. The day he died my voice and my memory came back. I screamed for an hour. Very primal. I haven't shut up since.
Land. Great-grandpa owned half of Pennsylvania. My Uncle wanted control and sold it all. All that's left is an old farmhouse and a horse pasture.
My father's murderer got away with it because I couldn't open my mouth.
Something good game out of it.
Martin Asher is dead, right?
That's the point. He's dead, so there won't be a trial where you or I would have to admit under oath that we did anything inappropriate.
Jesus.
How mean.   Serves you right.
John.    John.
I thought you were scared of blood?
That was my boss. I'm going back to Quantico tomorrow.
Staple his mouth too, Doc.
Vanderholt.
Not her son?   You're sure?
That's weird. Was he adopted, switched at birth?

Are you Martin?
Holy shit.
Who?

Shit!

Not here. This city no longer has the psychic gravity to hold him here. Try Mexico, getting a facelift.
Richard Hart.
Let me guess, Costa was selling stolen art for Hart and never gave him the money. Now Hart is just another one of Asher's victims.
Go to hell. I won't pay you a dime. I'm not scared of you.
Come and get me. I will never pay you, dumbass.
Asher taunted Hart into a confrontation. Jesus. It was right there in my face. I was interpreting behavior from two different suspects.
Anything he wants.
Ah, the undertakers have arrived for my career.
Yessir.
He needed a murder he could link not only Richard Hart to but also to his past victims.

Hart's behavior was consistent with a disorganized drug addict following the rules of the criminal road by attempting to kill a debtor who won't pay. He had no idea he was being manipulated by a serial killer.
Asher wasn't becoming disorganized and decomposing into madness, he was evolving.

The Ford murder was staged and I missed it. Asher drove Ford's car there with Ford unconscious in the car. Ether maybe, GHB. Something that disappears. Asher works out, heads to the parking lot. Pulls Ford out of the trunk. And strangles him. He left a couple of Hart's hairs on the body.
He draws a nice portrait of Mr.
Evidence at the Ford crime scene led to an apartment with more of Hart's DNA. And evidence linking Hart to Asher's crimes. Hart never set food in that apartment.
Yes. Hart thought Costa was systematically destroying his life. Hart's violent explosion was inevitable.
He couldn't. My guess is Asher intended to kill Hart and make it look like suicide. The authorities would find the body and close the Martin Asher file.
No.   I have nothing to say.
You'll manage.
It wasn't?
I'll dig a hole and hide in it.
Hello?
I'm here.
Six months.
Twins.

Get it over with. Just get it over with.
What happens if I don't want to assume this woman's identity and raise my babies with a serial killer?
Answer my question.
You'll do what you have to do. I can respect that. How do you know it's still real? Maybe it's gone.
God, I missed you so much.
Better you than me, asshole.
I can't tell you how excited we are to have you here.
This case made page one of the Globe. The tabloids say there is a headhunter on the loose.
The Mayor wants closure. That's his vacation house they were building. I get calls from supervisors I didn't know I had.

I don't solve crimes anymore, I balance budgets.
